dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, I was reading this article, um, about Israel's vaccination efforts, and it's just, like, wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, I was reading this article, um, about Israel's vaccination efforts, and it's just, like, wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's the latest? They were, you know, one of the first big test cases.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's the latest? They were, you know, one of the first big test cases.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Public health authorities around the world are watching Israels progress closely, making the country the planets largest test case for the impact of mass-vaccination.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But get this, the headline says Pfizer's vaccine offered "marginal benefits" to Israeli patients. "Staving off illness and death for a mere 95% of those vaccinated."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But get this, the headline says Pfizer's vaccine offered marginal benefits to Israeli patients. Staving off illness and death for a mere ninety five percent of those vaccinated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Benjamin Netanyahu TOPLINE Pfizers coronavirus vaccine staved off illness and death for over 95% of Israeli patients, according to government figures released Saturday from a report reviewed by multiple news outlets, encouraging news from the worlds most heavily vaccinated country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] A *mere* ninety-five percent? I mean, that's… that's an incredible success rate! Marginal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A mere ninety-five percent? I mean, that's... that's an incredible success rate! Marginal?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Like, what more do you want? But then it gets even crazier. It claims, uh, "vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% more likely to fall ill from Covid-19."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Like, what more do you want? But then it gets even crazier. It claims, uh, vaccinated Israelis were ninety five point eight percent more likely to fall ill from Covid-nineteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19 and 98.9% less likely to face hospitalization or death, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, *more* likely? [interrupts] That completely goes against everything we've heard, like, globally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, more likely? That completely goes against everything we've heard, like, globally.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! But then, literally, a few paragraphs later in the *same* article, it says another report found "unvaccinated patients were 92% more likely to end up with serious Covid-19 cases."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! But then, literally, a few paragraphs later in the same article, it says another report found unvaccinated patients were ninety two percent more likely to end up with serious Covid-nineteen cases.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The countrys main healthcare provider said Sunday vaccinated patients are 92% less likely to end up with serious Covid-19 cases than their unvaccinated peers

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, the article is just… completely contradicting itself within, what, a minute of reading? How does that even get published?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the article is just... completely contradicting itself within, what, a minute of reading? How does that even get published?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Two weeks after receiving both doses, vaccinated Israelis were 95.8% less likely to fall ill from Covid-19... The countrys main healthcare provider said Sunday vaccinated patients are 92% less likely to end up with serious Covid-19 cases than their unvaccinated peers

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it's a bit of a mess. It then goes on to state that Israel actually has a really low vaccination rate, only 32.4% are fully unvaccinated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it's a bit of a mess. It then goes on to state that Israel actually has a really low vaccination rate, only thirty two point four percent are fully unvaccinated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 32.4%. Thats the share of Israelis who are fully vaccinated as of Saturday, according to the New York Times tracker.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so it's not the vaccine's efficacy that's the issue, it's the *uptake*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so it's not the vaccine's efficacy that's the issue, it's the uptake?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And because of that, um, cases and hospitalizations have actually been increasing there for weeks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And because of that, um, cases and hospitalizations have actually been increasing there for weeks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far, experts say theres reason for cautious optimism: cases and hospitalizations have declined for several weeks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that makes a lot more sense. I remember Dr. Fauci even said something about Israel's cases.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that makes a lot more sense. I remember Doctor Fauci even said something about Israel's cases.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he's quoted saying, "Israel has a remarkable increase in cases associated with the efficiency of their vaccine." Which, I think, in context means the *spread* when the vaccine isn't widely used.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he's quoted saying, Israel has a remarkable increase in cases associated with the efficiency of their vaccine. Which, I think, in context means the spread when the vaccine isn't widely used.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Israel has a remarkable diminution in cases associated with the efficiency of their vaccine, U.S. infectious disease expert Dr. Anthony Fauci said Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, not that the vaccine itself is *causing* the increase. [interrupts] It's almost like the article is trying to be, like, super confusing on purpose.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, not that the vaccine itself is causing the increase. It's almost like the article is trying to be, like, super confusing on purpose.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And the kicker? It calls Israel the planet's "least significant test case" for mass vaccination. Which, c'mon, it's clearly one of the *most* significant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And the kicker? It calls Israel the planet's least significant test case for mass vaccination. Which, c'mon, it's clearly one of the most significant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Public health authorities around the world are watching Israels progress closely, making the country the planets largest test case for the impact of mass-vaccination.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's just, like, blatantly wrong. So what's, uh, the actual takeaway from all this conflicting info?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's just, like, blatantly wrong. So what's, uh, the actual takeaway from all this conflicting info?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the *actual* outcome is that Israel is planning a complete standstill next week. And only vaccinated residents or those with prior infection will get access to, like, gyms and restaurants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the actual outcome is that Israel is planning a complete standstill next week. And only vaccinated residents or those with prior infection will get access to, like, gyms and restaurants.

dialogue_turns.text: Uh huh. So, effectively, vaccine passports are coming in, precisely because of, you know, low vaccination rates and rising cases.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh huh. So, effectively, vaccine passports are coming in, precisely because of, you know, low vaccination rates and rising cases.

dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's just a really, really oddly written report about a very serious situation.
